meanings.definition: To render (an animal) incapable of reproducing.
meanings.sent1: The vet will be neutering the cat tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: Neutering pets helps control the animal population.
meanings.sent3: After neutering the dog, he couldn't understand why the other dogs were not interested in him.
meanings.sent4: The new law neutered the old regulations, making them obsolete.
meanings.sent5: Neutering the male rabbit made sure there were no unexpected litters.

meanings.sent1: The security system was neutered by a simple hack.
meanings.sent2: The villain's plan was neutered by the hero's quick thinking.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was neutered when the audience saw how it was done.
meanings.sent4: The storm neutered the power grid, leaving the town in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The new law neutered the opposition's arguments, leaving them speechless.
